intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium benitoi, commonly known as the Benito's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in harsh, cold environments. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, disc-like structure, typical of the genus Hieracium. The plant is often found in meadows and mountainous areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
